messages.subject: Re: Ham Radio funshop - interest?
messages.msgSnippet: My dh went last year, LOVED it!!!! and would definitely go again to get more info.  So, this is a yes to interested and a testimonial for the funshop, too
messages.messageBody:
My dh went last year, LOVED it!!!! and would definitely go again to
get more info. So, this is a yes to interested and a "testimonial"
for the funshop, too :-).

Peace~Jessica

messages.subject: Ham Radio funshop - interest?
messages.msgSnippet: Last year my dh, James (W6JHC) held an Amateur Radio funshop, with a fairly small attendance. Since for this kind of funshop to work well a lot of equipment
messages.messageBody:
Last year my dh, James (W6JHC) held an Amateur Radio funshop, with a fairly
small attendance. Since for this kind of funshop to work well a lot of
equipment has to be set up, and local hams would again be brought in, James
wants to get a feel for if there is interest in having another this year.

He was muttering something about trying to get in contact with the space
station, and is investigating the number of local repeaters situated nearby
(last year there just weren't very many in the area so they didn't get too
many contacts).

So any likely takers?

Robyn L. Coburn

--
No virus found in this outgoing message.
Checked by AVG Anti-Virus.
Version: 7.0.322 / Virus Database: 266.11.12 - Release Date: 5/17/2005
